definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: This is not the case with Kanban.
sentences.chinese: 有了看板，这不再是问题。

sentences.english: There are different ways to track progress like spreadsheets or Kanban boards.
sentences.chinese: 跟踪进度有不同的方法，例如电子表格或看板。

sentences.english: The number of Kanbans is reduced carefully to lower inventories and to reveal problems.
sentences.chinese: 谨慎地减少看板的数量来降低库存并揭露问题。

sentences.english: A Kanban should accompany each item, every time.
sentences.chinese: 每件产品每时每刻都要与看板相伴。

definition: to arrange (shifts, runs, classes etc) in order
to come up with an idea/generation of ideas/inspiration
